rounds.response:
[GAME] Current situation: we’re heads-up on the flop of 4♦ Q♣ K♠ with a dry 40-chip pot. I’m holding J♠ 5♠ and first to act. I have no pair, no draw beyond an unlikely gut-shot Broadway (which won’t give me the nuts) and my kicker is weak. This hand has virtually no showdown value versus a likely range of broadway-heavy hands, king-x, Q-x, and over-pairs that the small blind can check-calling with. The board also favors my current position here much less than it does my opponent — K-Q hit most value ranges.

Optimal play: give up immediately. Checking behind and trying to realize equity I don’t have is burning chips. If I check and villain bets turn, I’ll almost always be forced to fold anyway.

[Check]

rounds.response:
I'm looking at a junk-hand (J♠ 5♠) that made absolutely nothing—just J-high.  
Facing an opponent bet of 20 chips on the flop, I floated by checking. The turn brings 9♦, which also misses every one of my outs. My equity here is close to zero and there is no good “card to come” that can save me.

I’m done with this hand; any further chips thrown in are lighting money on fire.

[Fold]
